STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 31, 2024
Jennifer DeVivo
FOSTERING FUTURES
2008 HOGBACK RD STE 6, Suite 6
ANN ARBOR, MI, 48105-9751
Re: License #: CB810302599
SI #: 2025SIC0000006
Dear Jennifer DeVivo:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000006
Special Investigation Intake Date: October 2, 2024
License #: CB810302599
Licensee Group Organization: Fostering Futures
Licensee Designee: Jennifer Claire DeVivo
Chief Administrator: Jennifer Claire DeVivo
Agency Name: FOSTERING FUTURES
Agency Address: 2008 HOGBACK RD STE 6
Suite 6
ANN ARBOR, MI 48105-9751
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 08/10/2025
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
10/3/2024 8:00 AM Phone Interview
10/3/2024 8:00 AM Phone Interview
10/3/2024 9:50 AM Email Special Investigation Initiation
10/14/2024 1:00 PM Phone Interview
10/15/2024 1:00 PM Phone Interview
10/17/2024 1:45 PM Email Documentation received or sent
1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Visitation and family time; in person contact
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12421
Section • (1) An agency shall develop a plan of visitation and family
Description time for each child in foster care consistent with the child's
service plans, as required by R 400.12419 and R
400.12420 to ensure the safety and well-being of the child.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Parenting time is being cancelled by the agency due to staffing
issues and the time is not being made up.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on October 3,
2024. There was no additional information provided.
Biological Mother was interviewed via telephone on October
3, 2024. She stated she has supervised visitation with her two
children. It is supposed to be three times per week for two hours
each visit. There is also an option for a relative to supervise an
additional visit each week. Her mother was supervising a visit
each week at one point but this is no longer occurring. She
believes the agency has discretion to change the visitation to
unsupervised. She stated she doesn’t recall visitation
requirements being specified during any of the recent court
hearings. There was a parenting time agreement drafted in April
2024 that included the visitation schedule were on Monday’s,
Wednesday’s, Friday’s and a relative supervised on Sunday’s by
mutual agreement. She doesn’t recall the agency providing an
updated parenting time agreement since the one dated April 2024.
She stated there have been several occurrences where her
parenting time was cancelled for various reasons. She stated this
has been a pattern and is not something that recently started. She
stated she has text messages to verify this as well. A few months
ago, the agency took away her scheduled parenting time on
Monday’s due to staffing issues. Her visit was cancelled and there
was no plan to make up the lost time. She stated the agency does
not make alternative arrangements to make up the time she lost
due to the agency cancelling. She stated the agency will say they
owe her time, but it is never made up.
Foster Care worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on
October 14, 2024. She stated she has been the assigned worker
2

since May 2024. When she was assigned to the case, she was
notified parenting time is three times per week. It was four times
per week at one point, but the relative Caregiver stopped
supervising visitations due to some conflicts between her and
Biological Mother.
Monday visits ended right around Labor Day due to staffing issues
but have recently started up again due to staff availability.
Biological Mother was informed a few weeks ago that Mondays
are covered starting 10/7/24, however Biological Mother has new
employment, and this day no longer works for her schedule. The
visits have been two days per week, approximately two to two and
a half hours per visit. FCW stated Biological Mother is still having
supervised visits for 4 hours per week. She informed her she
would attempt to speak with relative Caregiver to see if she would
be willing to supervise an additional visit each week.
FCW stated the agency has visitation specialists who supervise
the majority of the parenting time. They try to be consistent for
each case. The specialist for Wednesday and Friday has
maintained the visits but the assigned worker on Mondays was no
longer able to supervise visits that day due to school obligations.
FCW stated she usually steps in if the visitation specialist isn’t
available, however she was out of the office for a significant
amount of time in September and wasn’t able to find another
worker to cover.
FCW stated the court doesn’t specify the time or frequency of
parenting time. They only specify supervised by agency or
designee and unsupervised visits needs to be consulted by
children’s GAL. FCW stated the court was notified the amount of
parenting time Biological Mother is given and were happy with the
agency’s effort. She stated the agency goes above and beyond
offering additional parenting time on their cases. She stated
Biological Mother receives the most parenting time on any of their
cases.
If parenting time is missed the agency attempts to make up the
missed time. In the summer it was easier to make up missed
parenting time but adding to scheduled visits. Due to school being
in session, it has become more challenging to make up lost time.
The agency is planning to start doing longer day visits.
Unsupervised visits were occurring but stopped due to a positive
drug screen. Biological Mother was told that would start up again
after a reporting period with just her medication showing in drug
3

screen results. FCW stated in a few weeks it will be a full reporting
period.
Foster Care Supervisor (FC Supervisor) was interviewed via
telephone on October 15, 2024. She stated the court has not
specified an amount of parenting time. The agency has attempted
to be expansive with the number of hours that are provided to
Biological Mother. At one point during the summer, the agency
was providing Biological Mother with six hours of supervised
parenting time along with a few hours of parenting time with
Caregiver supervising. Caregiver is no longer supervising due to a
conflict with Biological Mother.
The parenting time agreement from April 2024 outlined the
amount of parenting time the agency will provide to Biological
Mother. That form is provided so everyone is on the same page
with the visitation schedule. If, for whatever reason, a scheduled
parenting time is cancelled the agency keeps track of any time
that may be owed to a parent and then a plan is made to make up
the time. Regarding Biological Mother, FC Supervisor stated she
has already spoken with FCW to determine how they will make up
parenting time owed to Biological Mother. FC Supervisor stated
coordinating a parenting time schedule can be challenging due to
Biological Mother’s schedule, along with the children and
Caregiver’s schedule.
FC Supervisor acknowledged the agency has experienced some
staffing challenges and the month of September was extremely
challenging for the agency regarding staffing. She clarified
Biological Mother has never received less than 4 hours of
parenting time per week. The agency has hired additional staff
and now have a plan in place moving forward to provide the
parenting time outlined in the parenting time agreement. The plan
is to move toward unsupervised parenting time in November 2024.
Documents reviewed:
• 4/26/2024 (signed by FCW and Biological Mother)
parenting time agreement states “your current visit
schedule between you and your children is Monday,
Wednesday, Friday and relative supervised Sundays by
mutual agreement. Effective date is 4/19/24.
• 6/25/2024 & 9/16/2024 court order states parenting time is
supervised by MDHHS or its designee. The agency has
discretion for unsupervised visits if LGAL agrees. Court
order does not state the minimum amount of parenting time
per week.
4

• Fostering Futures Supervised Parenting Time Rules.
Outlines requirements for supervised parenting time but
does not address visitation cancelled by the agency and
how the time is made up.
• MISACWIS case file: Parenting time social work contacts.
3/25/2024 - Regularly scheduled parenting time. 2 hours
added to make up time lost on 3/22/24.
3/27/2024 - Regularly scheduled parenting time. The first 2
hours and 15 minutes of the visit was make up time. No
additional make up time is owed.
4/3/24 - Supervised parenting time in the community.
Children and visitation specialist both arrived a few minutes
late, but time added to the end of the visit to compensate.
No additional make up time is required.
4/8/24 - FCW texted Biological Mother and stated they don’t
have coverage for parenting time tonight and will owe make
up time.
4/17/2024 - Using Lyft to assist Biological Mother with
transportation. One hour owed to mother for missed time.
5/6/24 - Supervised parenting time from 4:30pm-6:30pm.
5/8/24 - Scheduled supervised parenting time from 3:45pm-
7:15pm with an hour and a half counting towards make up
time. No additional make up time is owed.
5/10/24 - Regularly scheduled supervised parenting time
from 3:45pm-6:30pm at mother’s apartment. The visit was
cancelled due to there not being enough staff to cover the
visit. 2.5 hours of make-up time is owed.
5/13/24 - Supervised parenting time from 4:30pm-6:30pm.
No make up time is owed.
5/19/24 - Scheduled make up time visit from 10:00am-
12:30pm.
5/27/24 - Supervised parenting time scheduled for 4:30pm-
6:30pm did not occur because it was Memorial Day and the
agency was closed for the holiday. Two hours of make time
is owed.
6/3/24 - Supervised parenting time scheduled for 4:30pm-
6:30pm but due to child’s appointment didn’t start until
5:30pm, 60 minutes of make-up time is owed.
6/12/24 - Supervised parenting time scheduled for 4:30pm-
6:30pm. The children were out of town, so visit did not
occur. Two hours of make-up time is owed.
6/14/24 - Regularly scheduled parenting time was from
4:00pm-6:30pm at Biological Mother’s apartment. The visit
was cancelled due to the children being out of town. 2.5
hours of make-up time is owed.
5

6/17/24 - Supervised parenting time schedule for 4:30pm-
6:30pm. Due to court hearing at 4:00pm the agency pushed
back the start of the visit to 5:00pm. One hour of make-up
time is owed.
6/19/24 - Supervised parenting time visit scheduled for
4:30pm-6:30pm. Agency was closed for Juneteenth holiday,
so visit did not occur. Two hours of make-up time is owed.
6/21/24 - Regularly scheduled supervised parenting time
from 4:30pm-6:30pm at Biological Mother’s apartment.
Children were 15 minutes late. 10 minutes of make-up time
is owed.
6/24/24 - Supervised parenting time from 4:30pm-6:30pm.
Children were 10 minutes late so visit was extended to
make up the time.
6/26/24 - Supervised parenting time from 4:30pm-6:30pm.
6/27/24 - Visit with relative Caregiver. Parenting time is
occurring Monday, Wednesday, Friday and occasionally
Sundays.
6/28/24 - Regularly scheduled supervised parenting time
from 4:30pm-6:30pm. No additional make up time is owed.
7/1/24 - Supervised parenting time scheduled for 4:30pm-
6:30pm. Youth B did not attend due to being sick, 2 hours
of make-up time is owed for Youth B only.
7/3/24 - Supervised parenting time scheduled from 4:30pm-
6:30pm.
7/5/24 - Regularly scheduled supervised parenting time was
from 4:30pm-6:30pm at Biological Mother’s apartment. The
visit was cancelled by the agency due to being short
staffed. 2 hours of make-up time is owed.
7/15/24 - Supervised parenting time from 4:30pm-unclear
end time. 15 minutes of make-up time is to be counted.
7/19/24 - Regularly scheduled supervised parenting time
from 4:30pm-6:30pm. Parties were 10 minutes early so 10
minutes of make-up time was used. No additional make up
time is owed.
7/24/24 - Supervised parenting time from 4:30pm-6:30pm. 5
minutes of make-up time is owed for Youth A.
7/26/24 - Supervised and unsupervised parenting time. 10
minutes of make-up time counted for Youth B; 16 minutes
of make-up time owed for Youth A.
8/2/24 - Regularly scheduled supervised/unsupervised
parenting time from 4:30pm-6:30pm. Biological Mother and
children were 10 minutes early. 10 minutes of make-up time
was given. No additional make up time is owed.
8/7/24 - Supervised parenting time scheduled for 4:30pm-
6:30pm. Biological Mother was required to work so the visit
6

was canceled. Biological Mother notified worker one week
in advance, so 2 hours of make-up time is owed for each
child.
8/19/24 - Supervised parenting time from 4:30pm-6:30pm.
Arrived late so 25 minutes of make-up time is owed.
8/30/24 - Regularly scheduled supervised parenting time
was from 4:30pm-6:30pm at mother’s home. No make up
time is owed.
9/2/24 - Nothing entered but this would have been a
scheduled day for parenting time.
9/9/24 - Nothing entered but this would have been a
scheduled day for parenting time.
9/13/24 & 9/16/24 - Nothing entered but this would have
been a scheduled day for parenting time.
9/23/24 - Nothing entered but this would have been a
scheduled day for parenting time.
9/27/24 - Regularly scheduled supervised parenting time
from 4:10pm-6:10pm at mother’s apartment. Visit was
cancelled by the agency due to there not being enough
staff. 2 hours of make-up time owed.
9/30/24 - Nothing entered but this would have been a
scheduled day for parenting time.
10/4/24 - Regularly scheduled visit from 4:10pm-6:10pm.
There was additional make up time from 6:10pm-6:50pm.
10/11/24 - FCW stated visit on 10/11/24 cancelled due to
staffing issues.
• Multiple text message between FCW and Biological Mother
were reviewed.
4/8/2024: visit cancelled due to staffing issues.
5/10/2024: visit cancelled due to staffing issues. Visit staff
sick and no one to cover. 8 make up visits owed, Time
offered on Tuesdays, Thursdays or Saturdays but Biological
Mother is not available as she works Saturdays.
5/22/2024: visit cancelled due to staffing issues.
7/1/2024: Youth B sick so make up time owed.
7/5/2024: visit cancelled due to staffing issues.
7/10/2024: visit cancelled due to staffing issues.
8/8/2024: visit cancelled due to staffing issues.
8/26/2024: visit cancelled on 8/26/2024 due to staffing
issues.
-Unclear on date; agency not able to cover Monday visits.
10/11/2024-FCW stated visit on 10/11/2024 cancelled due
to staffing issues.
7

Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance. Based on completed
interviews, MISACWIS case review and text messages between
FCW and Biological Mother the agency cancelled several
parenting time visits between Biological Mother and Youth A &
Youth B and did not make up the time.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
_______10/21/2024_________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
10/31/2024
